info.title: Rightbound External API
info.description:
Rightbound API for contacts enrichment 
# Need help?
email us at dev@rightbound.io

# Authentication using X-API-Key
To authenticate requests to the API, you need to include your API key in the header of each request. 
This API key is passed as the value of the `X-API-Key` header.

## Obtaining an API Key
To obtain an API key, please contact the administrator of the API. They will provide you with a unique key that grants access to the API's resources.

## Including the API Key in Requests
Once you have obtained your API key, include it in the header of each request you make to the API. Set the `X-API-Key` header to the value of your API key.
Here's an example of how to include the API key in a request using cURL:

```bash
curl -X GET   -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY"   https://externalapi.rightbound.io/v1/credits
```

Replace YOUR_API_KEY with your actual API key.

### Security Considerations
1. *Keep your API key confidential*: Treat your API key as a sensitive piece of information and avoid exposing it in public repositories or sharing it with unauthorized parties.
2. *Use HTTPS*: Ensure that requests to the API are made over HTTPS to encrypt the communication between your application and the API server, preventing interception of the API key.

By including your API key in the X-API-Key header of your requests, you can securely authenticate and access the resources provided by the API. 
 # Endpoints
## Enrichment Prospects Endpoint 
The `v1/prospects/enrich` endpoint is used to request enrichment for a list of prospects based on specified settings. Enrichment can include adding additional information such as mobile phone numbers and email addresses to the provided prospect data. Once enrichment is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the enriched data.

### Endpoint
`POST /v1/prospects/enrich`

### Request Body

```json
{
  "enrichment_settings": {
    "enrich_mobile_phone": true,
    "enrich_email": false
  },
  "prospect_requests": [
    {
      "id": "db825d84-cb95-4dc4-bb52-dec729cf9e8a",
      "linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/in/johndoe",
      "first_name": "John",
      "last_name": "Doe",
      "title": "Manager",
      "emails": ["john.doe@example.com"],
      "account_search_criteria": {
        "linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/company/example",
        "domain": "example.com",
        "name": "example inc."
      }
    }
  ],
  "callback_url": "https://your-callback-url.com",
  "metadata": {
    "account_id": "my_account_id",
    "user_id": "my_user_id"
  }
}
```
### Request Parameters
- `enrichment_settings`: Specifies the type of enrichment to perform.
    - `enrich_mobile_phone` (boolean, optional): Set to true to enrich mobile phone numbers.
    - `enrich_email` (boolean, optional): Set to true to enrich email addresses.
- `prospect_requests`: An array of prospect objects containing prospect details.
    - `id` (string): A unique identifier for each prospect.
    - `linkedin_url` (string, optional): LinkedIn URL of the prospect.
    - `first_name` (string, optional): First name of the prospect.
    - `last_name` (string, optional): Last name of the prospect.
    - `title` (string, optional): Title of the prospect.
    - `emails` (array of strings, optional): Email addresses associated with the prospect.
    - `account_search_criteria` (object, optional): Criteria for searching associated accounts.
        - `linkedin_url` (string, optional): LinkedIn URL of the account.
        - `domain` (string, optional): Domain of the associated account.
        - `name` (string, optional): Name of the associated account.
- `callback_url` (string): The URL to which the enriched prospect data will be sent once enrichment is complete.
- `metadata` (object): An object containing a unique user_id and account_id.
- `custom_fields` (object, optional): Custom fields to include in the response.

### Response
Upon successful submission of the enrichment request, a 202 OK response is returned. The enrichment process then runs asynchronously. Once completed, the enriched data will be sent to the specified callback_url.
Response status can be:
- `in_progress`: Enrichment process started 
- `pending`: Enrichment process pending to start
- `done`: Enrichment process is done
- `error`: Error in the Enrichment process

### Example Response
```json
{
  "job_id": "9d31d850-4486-4234-8945-b50901494cce",
  "status": "pending"
}
```

### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the enrichment process is completed. The enriched data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

The enriched data will include the unique id for each prospect, allowing you to match the enriched data with the corresponding prospect in your system.

## Enrichment Job Status Endpoint 

The `[GET] /v1/prospects/enrich/jobs/{job_id}` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of an enrichment job by its unique identifier (`job_id`). This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the enrichment process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Endpoint
`GET /v1/prospects/enrich/jobs/{job_id}`

### Path Parameters

- `job_id` (string): The unique identifier of the enrichment job.

### Response

The response will contain the current status of the enrichment job, represented as one of the following values:

- `PENDING`: The enrichment job is waiting to start.
- `IN_PROGRESS`: The enrichment job is still in progress.
- `DONE`: The enrichment job has been completed successfully.
- `ERROR`: An error occurred during the enrichment job.

### Example Response

```json
{
  "status": "DONE"
}
```

## Match Prospects Endpoint
The `v1/prospects/match` endpoint is used to request a match for a list of prospects based on input parameters. Once the match is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the match data.

### Endpoint
`POST /v1/prospects/match`

### Request Body

```json
{
  "prospect_requests": [
    {
      "id": "db825d84-cb95-4dc4-bb52-dec729cf9e8a",
      "linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/in/johndoe",
      "first_name": "John",
      "last_name": "Doe",
      "title": "Manager",
      "emails": ["john.doe@example.com"],
      "account_search_criteria": {
        "linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/company/example",
        "domain": "example.com",
        "name": "example inc."
      }
    }
  ],
  "callback_url": "https://your-callback-url.com",
  "metadata": {
    "account_id": "my_account_id",
    "user_id": "my_user_id"
  }
}
```
### Request Parameters
- `prospect_requests`: An array of prospect objects containing prospect details.
    - `id` (string): A unique identifier for each prospect.
    - `linkedin_url` (string, optional): LinkedIn URL of the prospect.
    - `first_name` (string, optional): First name of the prospect.
    - `last_name` (string, optional): Last name of the prospect.
    - `title` (string, optional): Title of the prospect.
    - `emails` (array of strings, optional): Email addresses associated with the prospect.
    - `account_search_criteria` (object, optional): Criteria for searching associated accounts.
        - `linkedin_url` (string, optional): LinkedIn URL of the account.
        - `domain` (string, optional): Domain of the associated account.
        - `name` (string, optional): Name of the associated account.
- `callback_url` (string): The URL to which the matched prospect data will be sent once match is completed.
- `metadata` (object): An object containing a unique user_id and account_id.
- `custom_fields` (object, optional): Custom fields to include in the response.

### Response
Upon successful submission of the match request, a 202 ACCEPTED response is returned. The match process then runs asynchronously. Once completed, the match data will be sent to the specified callback_url.

### Example Response
```json
{
  "job_id": "0d07a527-bcf9-497e-af4b-3005bb1d022f",
  "status": "PENDING"
}
```

### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the match process is completed. The match data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

The match data will include the unique id for each prospect, allowing you to match the matched data with the corresponding prospect in your system.

## Match Job Status Endpoint
The `[GET] /v1/prospects/match/jobs/{job_id}` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of an match job by its unique identifier (`job_id`). This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the match process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Endpoint
`GET /v1/prospects/match/jobs/{job_id}`

### Path Parameters

- `job_id` (string): The unique identifier of the match job.

### Response

The response will contain the current status of the match job, represented as one of the following values:

- `PENDING`: The match job is waiting to start.
- `IN_PROGRESS`: The match job is still in progress.
- `DONE`: The match job has been completed successfully.
- `ERROR`: An error occurred during the match job.

### Example Response

```json
{
  "status": "DONE"
}
```

## Track Prospects Endpoint
The `v1/prospects/track` endpoint is used to request tracking for a list of prospects and notify once there is a change in their job. Once a change it being notified, a callback URL is invoked with the updated data.

### Endpoint
`POST /v1/prospects/track`

### Request Body

```json
{
  "prospects_to_track": [
    {
      "id": "db825d84-cb95-4dc4-bb52-dec729cf9e8a",
      "tracked_prospect_linkedin_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/alonashkenazi",
      "tracked_company_linkedin_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/google",
      }
    }
  ],
  "callback_url": "https://your-callback-url.com",
  "metadata": {
    "account_id": "my_account_id",
    "user_id": "my_user_id"
  }
}
```

### Request Parameters
- `prospects_to_track`: An array of prospect objects to track.
    - `id` (string, optional) : An optional unique identifier for each prospect.
    - `tracked_prospect_linkedin_url` (string): LinkedIn URL of the prospect.
    - `tracked_company_linkedin_url` (string): LinkedIn URL of the company.
- `callback_url` (string): The URL to which the tracked prospect data will be sent.
- `metadata` (object): An object containing a unique user_id and account_id.
- `custom_fields` (object, optional): Custom fields to include in the response.

### Response
Upon successful submission of the track request, a 201 CREATED response is returned. The tracking process then runs asynchronously. Updates will be notified using the callback_url.

### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the changes in one or more of the tracked contacts will be notified. The updated data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

### Callback example

```json
{
  [
    {
      "id": "db825d84-cb95-4dc4-bb52-dec729cf9e8a",
      "tracked_prospect_linkedin_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/alonashkenazi",
      "tracked_company_linkedin_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/google",
      "tracked_company_title": "Director of Engineering"
      "current_company_linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/company/microsoft",
      "current_contact_title": "VP of Engineering",
      "changed_company": true,
      "changed_title": true,
      "changed_seniority": true,
      "created_at": "2024-02-19",
      "matched_at": "2024-02-19",
      "updated_at": "2024-03-15",
      
      }
    }
  ]
```

## Stop track Prospects Endpoint

### Endpoint
`DELETE /v1/prospects/track/{track_id}`

### Path Parameters

- `track_id` (string, optional): The unique identifier of the track list.

### Response
200 OK


## Get track History Endpoint
Returns hisotry of track changes events

### Endpoint
`GET /v1/prospects/track/history`

### Query Parameters

- `track_id` (string, optional): The unique identifier of the track list.
- `track_date` (datetime.date, optional): The date the tracking was created.

### Response
200 OK

## Available Credits Endpoint

The `/v1/credits` endpoint is used to retrieve the number of available credits. Credits typically represent units of currency or resources that can be consumed for various actions within the system.

### Endpoint

`GET /v1/credits`

### Response

The response will contain the current number of available credits.

#### Example Response

```json
{
    "credits": 1000
}
```

## Search Prospects Endpoint 
The `v1/search/prospects` endpoint is used to search (and enrich) prospects on a list of target accounts and persona definition. 
Once the process is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the data.

### Endpoint
`POST /v1/search/prospects`

### Request Body
```json
{
  "contact_search_definition": 
  {
    "company_linkedin_urls": [
      "https://www.linkedin.com/company/google",
      "https://www.linkedin.com/company/microsoft"
    ],
  "contact_filters": [
      {
        "contact_filter_name": "my filter",
        "functions": ["Growth"],
        "seniorities": ["VP"],
        "locations": ["US"]    
      }
    ]
  },
  "callback_url": "https://your-callback-url.com",
  "search_settings": {
    "max_contacts_per_company": 5,
    "max_contacts": 150
  },
  "metadata": {
    "account_id": "my_account_id",
    "user_id": "my_user_id"
  },
  "enrichment_settings": {
    "enrich_mobile_phone": true,
    "enrich_email": false
  }
}
```

### Request Parameters
- `contact_search_definition`: Specifies the search.
    - `company_linkedin_urls` (array of string): an array of strings, each defining a company linkedin url.
    - `contact_filters` (array): An array of contact filter definitions.
      - `contact_filter_name` (string): name of the filter
      - `functions` (array, optional): an array of strings identifying the job functions (see list of possible functions below)
      - `seniorities` (array, optional): an array of string identifying the seniorities (see list of possible seniorities below)
      - `locations` (array, optional): an array of locations (contact location)
- `callback_url` (string): The URL to which the prospect data will be sent once the process is complete.
- `search_settings` (object): An object containing the settings of the search.
  - `max_contacts_per_company` (int): maximum number of contacts from a single company
  - `max_contacts` (int): maximum number of contacts for the entire search
- `metadata` (object): An object containing a unique user_id and account_id.
- `custom_fields` (object, optional): Custom fields to include in the response.
- `enrichment_settings`: Specifies the type of enrichment to perform.
    - `enrich_mobile_phone` (boolean, optional): Set to true to enrich mobile phone numbers.
    - `enrich_email` (boolean, optional): Set to true to enrich email addresses.

### Response
Upon successful submission of the search request, a 202 OK response is returned. The  process then runs asynchronously. Once completed, the data will be sent to the specified callback_url.

#### Example Response
```json
{
  "job_id": "9d31d850-4486-4234-8945-b50901494cce",
  "status": "pending"
}
```

### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed. The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

#### Example Callback
```json
[
  {
    "contact_id": "db825d84-cb95-4dc4-bb52-dec729cf9e8a",
    "first_name": "Alon",
    "last_name": "Ashkenazi",
    "linkedin_id": "alonashkenazi",
    "linkedin_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/alonashkenazi,
    "title": "VP of Engineering",
    "seniority": "VP",
    "seniority_group": "Executive Management",
    "function": "Engineering and Technical",
    "function_group": "Engineering",
    "email": "alon@rightbound.io",
    "mobile_phone1:" "",
    "mobile_phone2:" "",
    "work_phone1:" "",
    "work_phone2:" "",
    "company_name": "RightBound",
    "company_website": "www.rightbound.com",
    "company_linkedin": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/rightbound",
    "company_size": "51-200 employees",
    "company_overview": "Data-driven. Autonomous. Constantly optimized. Sales Development, Re-imagined. RightBound is the only solution that turns the complete sales development journey into an autonomous process, enabling sales reps to focus on warmed up leads that are more-likely-to-convert, increasing ROI for sales development teams of all sizes.",
    "company_industry": "Software Development",
    "company_hq_country: "US",
    "company_hq_state": "WA",
    "company_hq_address": "218 Main St. Suite 541. Kirkland, Washington",
    "company_hq_zipcode": "98033"
  }
]
```

## Companies Match Endpoint 
The `v1/companies/match` endpoint is used to search (and match) companies and return their company linkedin profile. 
Once the process is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the data.

### Endpoint
`POST /v1/companies/match`

### Request Body
```json
{
  "companies_to_match": 
  [
    {
      "company_id": "3f814d73-046a-4c73-8705-08291ea5ec75",
      "company_name": "Microsoft"
    },
    {
      "company_id": "747f1ae3-9613-4503-87ce-f434a6d9168d",
      "company_domain": "www.apple.com"
    },
    {
      "company_id": "7b8f7514-fef6-4e85-b9bc-a7d6714f398d",
      "company_name": "RightBound",
      "company_domain": "www.rightbound.com"
    },
    {
      "company_id": "ba97ba31-f075-464f-9b73-3d93af386f84",
      "company_name": "A non existing company"
    }

  ]
  "callback_url": "https://your-callback-url.com",
  "metadata": {
    "account_id": "my_account_id",
    "user_id": "my_user_id"
  }
}
```

### Request Parameters
- `companies_to_match` (array): An array of companies to match.
  - `id` (string): a unique id for the company being matched.
  - `company_name`: (string, optional): name of the company.
  - `company_domain`: (string, optional): the domain of the company.
- `callback_url` (string): The URL to which the matched company data will be sent once the process is complete.
- `metadata` (object): An object containing a unique user_id and account_id.
- `custom_fields` (object, optional): Custom fields to include in the response.

### Response
Upon successful submission of the search request, a 202 OK response is returned. The  process then runs asynchronously. Once completed, the data will be sent to the specified callback_url.

#### Example Response
```json
{
  "job_id": "9d31d850-4486-4234-8945-b50901494cce",
  "status": "pending"
}
```

### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed. The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

#### Example Callback
```json
[
  {
    "id": "3f814d73-046a-4c73-8705-08291ea5ec75",
    "company_name": "Microsoft",
    "company_domain": "www.microsoft.com",
    "company_linkedin": "microsoft",
  },
  {
    "id": "747f1ae3-9613-4503-87ce-f434a6d9168d",
    "company_name": "Apple",
    "company_domain": "www.apple.com",
    "company_linkedin": "apple"
  },
  {
    "id": "7b8f7514-fef6-4e85-b9bc-a7d6714f398d",
    "company_name": "RightBound",
    "company_domain": "www.rightbound.com",
    "company_linkedin": "rightbound",
  },
  {
    "id": "ba97ba31-f075-464f-9b73-3d93af386f84"
  }
]
```


## Credits Report Endpoint

The `/v1/credits/report` endpoint is used to retrieve a report of the amount of credit used for each submitted enrichment job.

### Endpoint

`GET /v1/credits/report`

### Response

a dictionary containing the job ID and the amount of credit used for each submitted enrichment job
